pull.title: guix: use osslsigncode 2.12
pull.body:
Update osslsigncode used in Guix to [2.12](https://github.com/mtrojnar/osslsigncode/releases/tag/2.12).

Add zlib as an input, its a hard dependency since
https://github.com/mtrojnar/osslsigncode/pull/303.

Add `python-cryptography` and `python-minimal` for running the tests.

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

verification.payload:
tree 59a623b8c3784168e9c45c11bb693fcc3b4c8827
parent 8bb277c12373f2078844a336ef7d61b7d4373033
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1767874663 +0000
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1770127860 +0000

guix: use osslsigncode 2.12

Add zlib as an input, its a hard dependency since
https://github.com/mtrojnar/osslsigncode/pull/303.

events.message:
guix: use osslsigncode 2.12

Add zlib as an input, its a hard dependency since
https://github.com/mtrojnar/osslsigncode/pull/303.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -209,27 +208,17 @@ and abstract ELF, PE and MachO formats.")
 (define osslsigncode
   (package
     (name "osslsigncode")
-    (version "2.5")
+    (version "2.11")
     (source (origin
               (method git-fetch)
               (uri (git-reference
                     (url "https://github.com/mtrojnar/osslsigncode")
                     (commit version)))
               (sha256
                (base32
-                "1j47vwq4caxfv0xw68kw5yh00qcpbd56d7rq6c483ma3y7s96yyz"))))
+                "17vzkrv4qzjrjinjlgk8fbimkzd5b5akkpangkpn8cdficxgibxr"))))
     (build-system cmake-build-system)
-    (arguments
-     (list
-      #:phases
-      #~(modify-phases %standard-phases
-          (replace 'check
-            (lambda* (#:key tests? #:allow-other-keys)
-              (if tests?
-                  (invoke "faketime" "-f" "@2025-01-01 00:00:00" ;; Tests fail after 2025.
-                          "ctest" "--output-on-failure" "--no-tests=error")
-                  (format #t "test suite not run~%")))))))
-    (inputs (list libfaketime openssl))
+    (inputs (list openssl zlib))
comments.body:
The tests are currently being skipped because of missing dependencies:
```
-- Could NOT find Python3 (missing: Python3_EXECUTABLE Interpreter) 
-- CTest skips tests: Python3 not found
```

If skipping these is intentional, we should probably do so explicitly in the build configuration.

FWIW, there is an upstream implementation available here: [`bb898f243ad0c10ba1c59ddbfbf7091c19c0277d`](https://codeberg.org/guix/guix/commit/bb898f243ad0c10ba1c59ddbfbf7091c19c0277d).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -209,27 +208,17 @@ and abstract ELF, PE and MachO formats.")
 (define osslsigncode
   (package
     (name "osslsigncode")
-    (version "2.5")
+    (version "2.12")
     (source (origin
               (method git-fetch)
               (uri (git-reference
                     (url "https://github.com/mtrojnar/osslsigncode")
                     (commit version)))
               (sha256
                (base32
-                "1j47vwq4caxfv0xw68kw5yh00qcpbd56d7rq6c483ma3y7s96yyz"))))
+                "000balq0cw49jra9gvr8dk8x7ns9gd77qim3z8qci5rrkjbb8nai"))))
     (build-system cmake-build-system)
-    (arguments
-     (list
-      #:phases
-      #~(modify-phases %standard-phases
-          (replace 'check
-            (lambda* (#:key tests? #:allow-other-keys)
-              (if tests?
-                  (invoke "faketime" "-f" "@2025-01-01 00:00:00" ;; Tests fail after 2025.
-                          "ctest" "--output-on-failure" "--no-tests=error")
-                  (format #t "test suite not run~%")))))))
-    (inputs (list libfaketime openssl))
+    (inputs (list openssl python-cryptography python-minimal zlib))
comments.body:
FWIW, Guix people [suggest](https://codeberg.org/guix/guix/pulls/5533#issuecomment-9721154) using `python-minimal-wrapper`.

And test-specific dependencies could be listed as `native-inputs`.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -209,27 +208,17 @@ and abstract ELF, PE and MachO formats.")
 (define osslsigncode
   (package
     (name "osslsigncode")
-    (version "2.5")
+    (version "2.12")
     (source (origin
               (method git-fetch)
               (uri (git-reference
                     (url "https://github.com/mtrojnar/osslsigncode")
                     (commit version)))
               (sha256
                (base32
-                "1j47vwq4caxfv0xw68kw5yh00qcpbd56d7rq6c483ma3y7s96yyz"))))
+                "000balq0cw49jra9gvr8dk8x7ns9gd77qim3z8qci5rrkjbb8nai"))))
     (build-system cmake-build-system)
-    (arguments
-     (list
-      #:phases
-      #~(modify-phases %standard-phases
-          (replace 'check
-            (lambda* (#:key tests? #:allow-other-keys)
-              (if tests?
-                  (invoke "faketime" "-f" "@2025-01-01 00:00:00" ;; Tests fail after 2025.
-                          "ctest" "--output-on-failure" "--no-tests=error")
-                  (format #t "test suite not run~%")))))))
-    (inputs (list libfaketime openssl))
+    (inputs (list openssl python-cryptography python-minimal zlib))
comments.body:
> FWIW, Guix people [suggest](https://codeberg.org/guix/guix/pulls/5533#issuecomment-9721154) using python-minimal-wrapper.

What is the difference for us? Looks like `python-minimal-wrapper` just installs additional symlinks?
